alert.note: Alert for Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...An area of heavy rain will impact portions of southern Henry County through 300 AM CDT... At 214 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain over Woodhull, or 10 miles southwest of Cambridge, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water and minor flooding on roadways and in low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Kewanee, Galva, Woodhull, Alpha, Bishop Hill, Nekoma and Kewanee Municipal Airport. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 28 and 33. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches have fallen and an additional 0.50 to 1 inch of rain is possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement
